original: Bokander, Nils Gustav, leg. läkare, Borås, f. 18/1/07 i Trelleborg av överlär. Nils B. o. Anna Wilhetos^son. G. 38 m. Maj Smith. Barm Eva f. 43, Nils Georg 47. — Stud lex. i Malmö 26, med, kand. i Lund 30, med. lic. där 37. Studi-resa i Tyskl. 31. Tf. proviläk. kort. per. i Klippan, Hultsfred, Gravarne, Höör, Löberöd, Trelleborg o. Anderslöv 37-38, tf. undiläk. v. Borgholms las. 37, assist iläk. v. med. klin. i Lund 38-39, tf. und iläk. v. lungklin. i Malmö 39, tf. undiläk. v. BB i Hälsingborg, Gävle o. Norrköp. sammani. ett år 39-41, undiläk. v. Västerviks länslas. kir. avd. 41-44, undiläk. v. Borås centri-las. kir. avd. sed. 44. Led. av Lunds stud isångfören. lilla kör, ordf. i Borås akvariefören. Medl. av Frimurarorden, Odd Fellow o. Par Bricole. Hob-bies: sportfiske, fotografering, akvarium. Skyttem. i silver, mil. idr :m. i silver, Riksidr :förb. idr :m. i brons.
translated: Bokander, Nils Gustav, certified physician, from Borås. Born on January 18th, 1907 in Trelleborg to headmaster Nils B. and Anna Wilhetosson. Married to Maj Smith in 1938. They have two children, Eva born in 1943 and Nils Georg born in 1947. He studied law in Malmö in 1926 and medicine in Lund in 1930. He obtained his medical license in Lund in 1937 and went on a study trip to Germany in 1931. He worked as a temporary resident physician in several places such as Klippan, Hultsfred, Gravarne, Höör, Löberöd, Trelleborg, Anderslöv, and Borgholms hospital from 1937-1938. He also worked as an assistant physician at the medical clinic in Lund from 1938-1939, and as a temporary resident physician at the lung clinic in Malmö, as well as at the maternity ward in Helsingborg, Gävle, and Norrköping for a year from 1939-1941. He worked as an assistant physician at the surgical division of Västervik county hospital from 1941-1944, and as a resident physician at the surgical division of Borås central hospital since 1944. He was a member of Lund's Student Singing Association and the chairman of Borås Aquarium Association. He was also a member of the Freemasons, Odd Fellow, and Par Bricole. His hobbies included sportfishing, photography, and aquariums. He won silver in shooting and military sports, and a bronze in national sports.
